sections.heading: The Simple Rule
sections.content: に = Where something exists/is で = Where you do something

sections.heading: Quick Decision
sections.content:
Ask: "Is this about existing/being somewhere, or doing an action?"

Existing/being → に Doing an action → で

children.heading: Example 1: Library
children.content: 図書館にいる "be at the library" (existence) 図書館で勉強する "study at the library" (action)

children.heading: Example 2: Home
children.content: 家にある "be at home / exist at home" 家で寝る "sleep at home" (action of sleeping)

children.heading: Example 3: School
children.content: 学校にいる "be at school" 学校で働く "work at school" (action)

sections.heading: Existence Verbs (Always に)
sections.content: いる - be/exist (animate) ある - be/exist (inanimate) 住む - live/reside 東京に住んでいる - "live in Tokyo" 部屋に猫がいる - "there's a cat in the room" 机の上に本がある - "there's a book on the desk"

sections.heading: Action Verbs (Use で)
sections.content: 勉強する - study 働く - work 遊ぶ - play 食べる - eat 買う - buy 図書館で勉強する - "study at library" レストランで食べる - "eat at restaurant" 公園で遊ぶ - "play in park"

sections.heading: Movement Verbs (Special Case)
sections.content:
Destination uses に:

学校に行く - "go to school" 日本に来る - "come to Japan" 家に帰る - "return home"

sections.heading: Common Patterns
sections.content: | Situation | Particle | Example | | ------------------- | -------- | ------------ | | Be somewhere | に | 部屋にいる | | Live somewhere | に | 東京に住む | | Go somewhere | に | 学校に行く | | Do action somewhere | で | 図書館で勉強 | | Meet somewhere | で | 駅で会う | | Buy somewhere | で | 店で買う |

children.heading: With 会う (meet)
children.content:
駅に会う - "meet AT the station" (destination) 駅で会う - "meet at the station" (location of meeting)

Both grammatically correct, で more common for "meet at."

children.heading: With いる
children.content:
部屋にいる - "be in the room" (location) 部屋でいる - ✗ Usually wrong

Exception: When emphasizing action/state in a place:

ここでいてください - "Please stay here"

sections.heading: Transportation (Use で)
sections.content:
車で行く - "go by car" 電車で来る - "come by train" バスで帰る - "return by bus"

Exception: 歩いて (on foot) doesn't use particle:

✓ 歩いて行く ✗ 足で行く

sections.heading: Decision Flowchart
sections.content: Is the verb ある/いる/住む? └─ Yes → に Is it a movement verb (行く/来る/帰る)? └─ Yes → に (destination) Is it an action verb? └─ Yes → で (action location)

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using で with いる
children.content: Wrong: 部屋でいる ❌ Right: 部屋にいる ✓

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using に with Action Verbs
children.content: Wrong: 図書館に勉強する ❌ Right: 図書館で勉強する ✓

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing Destination with Action Location
children.content: Wrong: 学校で行く ❌ Right: 学校に行く ✓ (destination) Wrong: 学校に働く ❌ Right: 学校で働く ✓ (action location)

sections.heading: Memory Tricks
sections.content:
に = "IN" (existence, destination) で = "DO" (action location)

に = static, being で = dynamic, doing

children.heading: Scenario 1: Daily Routine
children.content: 家にいる → 家を出る → 電車で行く → 会社に着く → 会社で働く "Be at home → Leave home → Go by train → Arrive at company → Work at company"

children.heading: Scenario 2: Shopping
children.content: 店に行く → 店で買い物する → 店にいる "Go to store → Shop at store → Be at store"

children.heading: Scenario 3: Studying
children.content: 図書館に行く → 図書館で勉強する → 図書館にいる "Go to library → Study at library → Be at library"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ に for existence (いる/ある/住む) ✓ で for action location ✓ に for destination (行く/来る/帰る) ✓ で for means/method ✓ Ask: "existing or doing?"

Related:

に (ni) - Location/Direction で (de) - Location/Means へ vs に Direction
